datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Global objects are mirrored to VDOMs, and VDOMs have their own entries.
This is required only when modifying an object in the global scope.
scope=[global|vdom]

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Global objects are mirrored to VDOMs, and VDOMs have their own entries.
This is required only when modifying an object in the global scope.
scope=[global|vdom]

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Global objects are mirrored to VDOMs, and VDOMs have their own entries.
This is required only when modifying an object in the global scope.
scope=[global|vdom]

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

options.name: pass
options.help: Allow sessions matching an application in this application list.
options.label: Pass
options.description: Allow sessions matching an application in this application list

options.name: block
options.help: Block sessions matching an application in this application list.
options.label: Block
options.description: Block sessions matching an application in this application list

app-replacemsg.name: app-replacemsg
app-replacemsg.help: Enable/disable replacement messages for blocked applications.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable replacement messages for blocked applications.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable replacement messages for blocked applications

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable replacement messages for blocked applications.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable replacement messages for blocked applications

enforce-default-app-port.name: enforce-default-app-port
enforce-default-app-port.help: Enable/disable default application port enforcement for allowed applications.

force-inclusion-ssl-di-sigs.name: force-inclusion-ssl-di-sigs
force-inclusion-ssl-di-sigs.help: Enable/disable forced inclusion of SSL deep inspection signatures.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable forced inclusion of signatures which normally require SSL deep inspection.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable forced inclusion of signatures which normally require SSL deep inspection

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable forced inclusion of signatures which normally require SSL deep inspection.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable forced inclusion of signatures which normally require SSL deep inspection

unknown-application-action.name: unknown-application-action
unknown-application-action.help: Pass or block traffic from unknown applications.

p2p-block-list.name: p2p-block-list
p2p-block-list.help: P2P applications to be block listed.

options.name: options
options.help: Basic application protocol signatures allowed by default.

risk.name: risk
risk.help: Risk, or impact, of allowing traffic from this application to occur (1 - 5; Low, Elevated, Medium, High, and Critical).

level.name: level
level.help: Risk, or impact, of allowing traffic from this application to occur (1 - 5; Low, Elevated, Medium, High, and Critical).

popularity.name: popularity
popularity.help: Application popularity filter (1 - 5, from least to most popular).

action.name: action
action.help: Pass or block traffic, or reset connection for traffic from this application.

log.name: log
log.help: Enable/disable logging for this application list.

options.name: periodical
options.help: Allow configured number of packets every rate-duration.
options.label: Periodical

options.name: continuous
options.help: Block packets once the rate is reached.
options.label: Continuous

options.name: attacker
options.help: Block all traffic sent from attacker's IP address. The attacker's IP address is also added to the banned user list. The target's address is not affected.
options.label: Attacker

quarantine-expiry.name: quarantine-expiry
quarantine-expiry.help: Duration of quarantine. (Format ###d##h##m, minimum 1m, maximum 364d23h59m, default = 5m). Requires quarantine set to attacker.

control-default-network-services.name: control-default-network-services
control-default-network-services.help: Enable/disable enforcement of protocols over selected ports.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable protocol enforcement over selected ports.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable protocol enforcement over selected ports

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable protocol enforcement over selected ports.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable protocol enforcement over selected ports

violation-action.name: violation-action
violation-action.help: Action for protocols not in the allowlist for selected port.

options.name: pass
options.help: Allow protocols not in the allowlist for selected port.
options.label: Pass

options.name: monitor
options.help: Monitor protocols not in the allowlist for selected port.
options.label: Monitor

options.name: block
options.help: Block protocols not in the allowlist for selected port.
options.label: Block
